member_organisations: Participating organizations included: Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), U.S.A., Western Canadian Centre of Activity and Aging, Active Aging Working group, the Health Enhancing Physical Activity-Europe, European Group for Research into Elderly and Physical Activity,  EUROSAFE, International Association of Physical Therapists working with Older People (IP-TOP), European Innovation Partnership on Active and Healthy Ageing (EIP-AHA), School of Sport, Exercise and Rehabilitation Sciences, University of Birmingham/Pannini project, Division of Non communicable Diseases and Life-course, WHO Regional Office for Europe,  SCA, E-no-Falls, European Projects Health - Renewable Energy - Sustainable Planning
fields_of_interest: Research and innovation, Public Health, Sport
eu_initiatives: Drafting and disseminating of a shared statement (Rome Statement) on physical activity promotion with the following organisations: Participating organizations included: Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), U.S.A., Western Canadian Centre of Activity and Aging, Active Aging Working group, the Health Enhancing Physical Activity-Europe, European Group for Research into Elderly and Physical Activity,  EUROSAFE, International Association of Physical Therapists working with Older People (IP-TOP), European Innovation Partnership on Active and Healthy Ageing (EIP-AHA), School of Sport, Exercise and Rehabilitation Sciences, University of Birmingham/Pannini project, Division of Non communicable Diseases and Life-course, WHO Regional Office for Europe,  SCA, E-no-Falls, European Projects Health - Renewable Energy - Sustainable Planning
organisation_name: European Network for Action on Ageing and Physical Activity (EUNAAPA)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: Members are still busy with registering on our new website, we included countries that are active in the EU projects performed by the network.
goals__remit:
Vision: Optimal health and quality of life for older people in Europe through physical activity 
Goal: To use evidence-based strategies to improve health and quality of life among older people in Europe through physical activity. 
Membership is free for interested individuals
relevant_communication: Dissseminaton and publication of Training curriculum and Rome statement (www.eunaapa.org)
